revised_title: Julian Huxley's Evolutionary Studies and Impact on Science and Society
tldr: This book review discusses the life and work of Julian Huxley, a prominent biologist and thinker. It explores his contributions to the field of evolutionary studies, his influence on modern ethology, and his ideas on the relationship between evolution and morality. The review also touches upon Huxley's role as the first Director General of UNESCO and his interest in eugenics. The book offers a comprehensive overview of Huxley's work and its impact on science and society.
